# Roleplay Rule 8 – No Antagonist Teams Exist; Do Not Create Them
Prospect Sector has **no antagonist roles** and therefore no antagonist teams. There are no traitors, operatives, cults, revolutions, zombies, or carp factions controlled by players.
Because of this, **no player may create or act as part of an antagonist group**, whether formally or informally.
You may not: - Form secret teams with the goal of harming the station - Create “villain factions” as a roleplay gimmick - Invent your own antagonist objectives - Coordinate sabotage, uprisings, or destructive plots - Roleplay as Syndicate-aligned, revolutionary, cultist, zombie, or similar groups - Encourage others to disrupt the round as part of a shared RP narrative
All roles in Prospect Sector are cooperative roles. No one is permitted to unite into a player-made antagonist force.
## Examples
### Acceptable: - Forming a harmless RP club (gardening club, explorers' guild, bar game night). - Cooperating as a group to run expeditions or repair the station. - Having disagreements or rivalries as long as they remain non-destructive. - A character changing personal goals through RP (career change, personality shift).
### Prohibited: - Forming a “revolutionary group” to overthrow command. - Creating a “cult” with goals tied to sabotage or harm. - Coordinating as a team to disrupt engineering, power, atmos, cargo, or expeditions. - Acting like a Syndicate cell or inventing your own antagonistic faction. - Grouping together to attack or grief crew members. - Working to make the station uninhabitable as part of a player-made storyline. - Encouraging others to perform sabotage as part of "team RP." - Attempting to mimic upstream antagonist factions (ops, heretics, zombies, changelings, cults, etc.).
## Final Note Prospect Sector is built entirely around **cooperative progression**. No player or group may assume, create, or simulate an antagonist role. Admins will treat any such behavior as intentional disruption.
